properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 11 at 2:38PM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Aberdeen SD
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, light snow and areas of
blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one
inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill
Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as
35 below zero by evening.

* WHERE...Potter, Faulk, Sully, Hyde and Hand Counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM to 6 PM CST
Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Wednesday to
noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The
dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed
skin in as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY
